newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Troy cites drill results for shr rise.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Troy cites drill results for shr rise.

text.p: Troy Resources NL said on Thursday that significant high-grade intersections detected at its Cornishman gold propsect in Western Australia was the likely cause for a sharp rise in its share price.
Troy shares gained 23 cents on Wednesday to close at A$0.90 but have since retreated to about $0.85 cents.

"The company has no reason to believe that the current year's operating loss before abnormal items and tax will vary more than 15 percent from that of the previous year," Troy said in a statement to the Australian Stock Exchange, which queried the share price rise.

Troy said on Wednesday that recent drilling at the Cornishman prospect had extended the strike length of the Triple-O mineralisation to about 950 metres, up from 350 metres reported in the previous quarter.
Troy holds a 49 percent interst in the prospect while Sons of Gwalia Ltd SGW.AX holds 51 percent.
